constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: A4D Storage and distribution to residential

decision_conditions: <p>The energy efficiency and renewable energy measures proposed for the development hereby approved, to include existing and proposed fabric efficiencies, 450w solar panels and an air source heat pump (ASHP) shall be implemented at build stage and/or prior to first use of the development in accordance with the Energy Statement accompanying the application.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON:&nbsp; In the interests of sustainable construction and to mitigate against climate change.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of each part of the building or use, a 'Secured by Design' accreditation shall be obtained for such building or part of such building or use, and thereafter all features are to be permanently retained.</p><p>REASON: To ensure the safety of the occupiers of the development.</p>

<p>The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until full details of sound insulation between the synagogue and residential unit have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.</p><p>The approved details shall show that noise levels within habitable rooms shall comply with the recommendations of BS8233: 2014 'Sound insulation and noise reduction for buildings.' The sound insulation of the facades shall achieve the standard of sound insulation required, as defined in BS8233: 2014.</p><p>REASON: To protect the amenities of residential occupiers from noise nuisance.</p><div><br></div>

<p><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">The use hereby permitted shall only be carried out between the hours of 0700 and&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">2400 daily.&nbsp;</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"></p><p><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To ensure that the use operates in a satisfactory manner and&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenities.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">An Operational Management Plan, including details of servicing, waste&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">management, and measures to prevent undue noise disturbance to&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">surrounding residential occupiers, particularly in relation to the management&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">of arrival and dispersal of worshippers outside of the premises, shall be&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">before the use commences. The&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">Operational Management Plan as approved shall be fully implemented during worship times.</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring owners/occupiers&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">and to ensure that the proposal is acceptable in terms of highways and noise and disturbance&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">impacts.</span><br></p>

<p>No tannoys or public address systems shall be used unless details have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to use and thereafter be permanently retained.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the amenities of occupiers of surrounding premises are not adversely affected by noise.</p>

<p>The development hereby permitted shall not be used until a full Travel Plan, indicating modes of transport to the site, including trip numbers and times of travel, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.&nbsp; The plan shall include SMART targets that are: specific, measurable, achievable, realistic, and time-bound.&nbsp; </p><p>The Travel Plan shall be reviewed and monitored annually for at least 5 years in consultation with the local planning authority and an appointed Travel Plan Coordinator (TPC).&nbsp; Reviews should evaluate the plan and ensure that the targets are appropriate to encourage sustainable transport uptake.&nbsp; New interim targets should be set and correspond to Hackney Borough Council's Transport Strategy and its adopted LP33.&nbsp; &nbsp;</p><p>The development shall only be implemented and operated in accordance with the approved details and measures whereby the approved full Travel Plan will be required to be produced and implemented upon occupation of the development,</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of highway safety.<br></p>

<p>No development shall commence, other than works of demolition, until a report (including intrusive investigation/trial pit and monitoring where necessary) demonstrating that the basement development will not increase the potential for groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority.</p><p>Details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance measures against surface water and groundwater (if identified) shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval and the approved measures incorporated before the basement is occupied.&nbsp; The basement shall be constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for "protection of below ground structures against water from the ground" and current best practice.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To safeguard the development from surface water and groundwater flooding.<br></p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout, and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, rain garden, bio-retention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA and retained like so thereafter. </p><p>If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p>REASON: To promote sustainable drainage.<br></p><div><br></div>

<p>The ground floor and basement premises shall be used as a synagogue and for no other purposes including any other purpose in Class F1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Uses Classes) Order 1987 or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re- enacting that Order.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In granting this permission, the local planning authority has had regard to the special circumstances of this case and to the policies contained in the prevailing Development Plan, and considers that planning permission would have been refused for unrestricted use within Class F1 of the Use Classes Order.</p><div><br></div>

<p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby approved detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority, in writing, before any work is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- a biodiverse, substrate-based extensive green/brown roof (of variable depth between 80mm and 150mm), including a detailed maintenance plan.</p><p>REASON: To enhance the character and ecology of the development, to provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban drainage, to enhance the performance and efficiency of the proposed building and assists in the meeting the Local Development Framework Core Strategy objective of reducing carbon emissions.</p><div><br></div>

<p>No development shall take place until a detailed Demolition and Construction Management Plan covering the matters set out below has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the demolition and construction management plan, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.</p><p><br></p><p>a) A demolition and construction method statement covering all phases of the development to include details of noise control measures and measures to preserve air quality (including a risk assessment of the demolition and construction phase) and details of dust mitigation measures during site clearance and construction works (including any works of demolition of existing buildings or breaking out or crushing of concrete);</p><p><br></p><p>b) A demolition and construction traffic management plan to include the following: the construction programme/ timescales; the number/ frequency and size of construction vehicles; construction traffic route; location of deliveries; pedestrian and vehicular access arrangements; any temporary road/ footway closures during the construction period;</p><p><br></p><p>c) A demolition and construction waste management plan setting out how resources will be managed and waste controlled at all stages during the construction project;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity. The condition is required to be discharged prior to the commencement of the development as uncontrolled demolition and construction could be prejudicial to highway safety and the amenities of neighbouring occupiers.</p><div><br></div>

<p>Full details, with samples, of the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the development, including glazing, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing before any work proceeds beyond damp proof course. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved. The submitted details should include bricks and not brick slips.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p><div><br></div>

<p>Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority, in writing, before any work proceeds beyond damp proof course. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>a) details of windows and doors, including reveals;</p><p>b) details of cycle storage, including stand sizes and spacing;</p><p>c) detailed drawings of the refuse and recycling storage and details of arrangements for the collection of waste.</p><p>The cycle and waste storage shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area, and to ensure adequate provision of cycle and waste storage.</p>

<p><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">Noise from any mechanical equipment ventilation/service equipment</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background (LA90 15 min) noise&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">level.</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"></p><p><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To safeguard against noise nuisance to owners/occupiers of the&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">adjoining residential properties.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">All windows and doors shall remain closed during worship times.</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"></p><p><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To safeguard against noise nuisance to occupiers of the</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">adjoining residential properties.</span><br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall incorporate appropriate habitat measures for nesting birds, such as swift boxes, and also bat boxes for the external faces of the building, details of which shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval.&nbsp; The approved measures shall subsequently be implemented prior to first use and shall be retained.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON:&nbsp; In the interests of bio-diversity.</p>

No, meter boxes, antennas, satellite dishes, soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the (street) elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved.


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

The noise level from all plant and machinery included in the approved development shall at all times remain 5dB(A) below background levels when measured at any nearby residential window.


REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise.

The windows indicated as obscure glazed on the approved drawings shall be obscure glazed in accordance with details to be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority, and shall also be fixed shut below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level.


The windows shall be installed prior to first use of the development and thereafter be retained with the approved obscure glazing.


REASON: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans and documents hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
description: Extensions to existing property including creation of a second floor  and  basement floorspace to provide a synagogue across  basement and ground floor levels, and a 3-bedroom residential unit across the first and second floor, along with associated cycle and waste storage.
